fields.description: The setup process should detect which Database you are using, and manually adjust the columns for you.
fields.summary: Setup Process should alter table types

fields.description: After installing (& creating admin account)    Clicked on first link (Find and Filter Issues)... got a page with an empty  select box (I have not setup any projects). A message explaining that it's  blank because no projects have been setup would be nice.    Clicking on next link (Create Issue) causes a NullPointerException (again  because I have no projects).    Hit enter on the issue# input box (just to be annoying), and got an  exception saying 'actions is null'.
fields.summary: Filter & Create Issues should work when no projects

fields.description: Sorting by resolution in the IssueNavigator gives a "currentPage = null" error.
fields.summary: Sorting by resolution gives error

fields.description: Need to add more empty parameters to the url for all new filter properties.
fields.summary: Preset filter for ALL no longer shows all issues

fields.description: As said ;)
fields.summary: Filtering for 'Unresolved' doesn't work

fields.description: Add time zones to user profile.     That way the dates displayed to a user are always contiguous with their local time zone, rather than the server's time zone.
fields.summary: User Preference: User Time Zones

fields.description: "in 'find and filter issues' the dates 'created/updated' say things like today and yesterday, when we know they were created on different days than today and yesterday."

fields.description: "in 'add issue' you can select a version in which the issue occurs, but you can't select a 'fix in version x' in that screen, you have to save issue, and then go and edit it."

fields.description: "it would be nice to be able to filter on issues for specific components."
fields.summary: Ability to filter on components

fields.description: "in 'find and filter issues' either add a Filter 'submit' button to the top of the page, so you don't have to scroll down when you change projects, or move the non-preset filters off onto an advanced filters tab.  (or even auto submit when chosen a project in pulldown)"

fields.description: Priority always resets itself to minor if there is a error in the creation.
fields.summary: Priority doesn't persist on CreateIssue form

fields.summary: ObjectNotFoundException editing issue version

fields.description: "the login screen says 'username' which isn't immediately obvious as the email address"
fields.summary: username on login form should be email

fields.description: "the email address is case sensitive, bit annoying having to remember the case when you login."
fields.summary: Email addresses are case sensitive

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Project Type on the left side bar changes when a user clicks on the Automation link
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to the Automation page in a software project in a site which also has service projects.
 * Note that the URL is *https://<your site>.[atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/|http://atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/]<project key>/settings/automate#/*
 * Note that the top of the left side bar shows your project name with 'Software Project'
 * Note that at the top of the page you can see
 * Projects/<project name>/Project Settings/Automation
 * Click on this Automation link at the top of the page
 * Note that the URL is now *https://<yoursite>.[atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/|http://atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/]<project key>/settings/automate*
 * Note that the top of the left side bar shows your project name with 'Service Project'

h3. Expected Results

It is supposed to reload the same Automation page.
h3. Actual Results

It is supposed to reload the same page  but show Service project details under Software projects.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Re-opening Automation from the same project works fine.
fields.summary: Project Type on the left side bar changes when a user clicks on the Automation link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *New Global issue create experience* does not respect the *version order* of the custom field
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Version Picker (multiple version) custom fields
 # Edit the context -> Edit Version Order 
 # Select Unreleased version so it should be the first item in the list

h3. Expected Results

To show the Unreleased version first
h3. Actual Results

It does not apply the ordering
h3. Workaround

Edit personal settings and set the *New Global issue create experience* to *Stay on the old experience.*
fields.summary: The New Global issue create experience does not respect the version order of the custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create issue view does not respect the version order of the custom field 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Version Picker (multiple version) custom fields
 # Edit the context -> Edit Version Order 
 # Select Unreleased version so it should be the first item in the list

h3. Expected Results

To show the Unreleased version first
h3. Actual Results

It does not apply the ordering
h3. Workaround

Edit personal settings and set the *New Global issue create experience* to *Stay on the old experience.*
fields.summary: Create issue view does not respect the version order of the custom field

fields.description:
Customer's Request from the support this [ticket|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-620500?error=login_required&error_description=Login+required&state=a09ec58b-7f2b-4a2f-85cb-06dff1313bf5].
{quote}Hi,

I would like to get role 'Service Desk Customers' from project 'BS' using url returned from rest/api/3/project/<project key>/role call.
At this moment this is the link:
[https://gltechnologies.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/13316/role/10101]
and unfortunately it hangs (returns 'Page unavailable'). I suppose that the list is big, but I would expect that return size is limited and 'startAt' parameter could be used.

Regards,
Bogdan
{quote}
Internal analysis:

Customer is unable to request list of users having a specific service desk role because of large number of users. `/rest/projectconfig/1/roles/\{projectKey}` is an internal API that is already paginated and could be used for the same purpose.
fields.summary: Request for list of users having a specific service desk role Hangs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When sending email in Jira via "Send Email" functionality, on the return page Jira is displaying some uid instead of username and when you click on it, it redirects to non- existing user page and error 'Failed to load user details' is returned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira Settings > System > Send Email (https://_instance_.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SendBulkMail!default.jspa)
 # Choose "To" any group with list of users. Fill in all required fields.
 # Click "Send" and observe "Username" displays some ID instead of actual username.

h3. Expected Results

Actual username is returned for list of users email has been sent to.
h3. Actual Results

Some uid is displayed (e.g. ug:33eeab78-92e0-4ec3-acad-aeb03d961f12) and when you click on it, it redirect to non-existing user page and error 'Failed to load user details' is returned.
h3. Workaround

It does not email send email functionality. User list can be accessible from within the group - go to group under admin portal and review group membership.
fields.summary: Send Email functionality in Jira returns uid instead of username on summary page

fields.description:
h3. Problem
There are scenarios where Jira Automation rules are needed to be run sequentially or in serial. Currently rules and branches run in parallel, meaning in certain scenarios elements further down the automation rule which are dependent of the outcome of a specific branch are fired too early and a false positive or failure occurs.

h3. Scenario or Use Case
An example of how the current behavior can impact an automation rule can be seen in the below example (extremely high level overview):

# Trigger a rule when the request participants (Jira Service Management) are edited
# Re-fetch the data and using Advanced branching loop through each value
# Match these values against a regex condition
# Set a custom label when this regex condition is met
# Once the above for each action on the Advanced branch completes, check if the label is present
# If the label is present, take an action ie post a comment

In the above scenario, it's possible that while points *2*, *3* and *4* are happening, in parallel the check in point *5* is completed. If the user is at the end of a longer list of participants, it's possible that the action (adding of the label) was not completed at the time the presence of it is checked.

Due to this, the rule will either provide a false positive or fail. Being able to adjust in which manner the automation rule is running (serial vs parallel), we can provide an improved user experience, expanding on the ability to create new rules similar to the above and a consistent experience.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to run Jira Automation rules and branching sequentially
Notification in case email to mail server fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to do a Quick Search for a text containing an underscore (_) doesn't yield any sugestions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Issue and populate any of its text fields with a phrase containing an underscore
 # Perform a Quick Search for that exact term

h3. Expected Results

The suggestions should include the Issue matching that term
h3. Actual Results

No suggestions get displayed
h3. Workaround

After entering the search term hit enter, if there is a match it will be displayed in the search results.
fields.summary: Searching for text containing underscore (_) in Quick Search does not return any suggestion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, only the direct notifications are taken into account to show the unread numbers in the in-app notification.

!Screen Shot 2022-01-04 at 18.07.41.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to include the *watching* notifications to the Notification Indicator, along with the direct ones.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to include the watching notifications to the Notification Indicator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

“issue creation” fails with error as “{{{}Invalid Input{}}}” when a multi-line custom field and is used in create issue screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a paragraph/multi-line custom field.
 # Ensure the field is attach to the issue create screen.
 # Set a default value.
 # Create an issue using the new global issue create.
 # Issue create fails with INVALID_INPUT response.

h3. Expected Results

Issue created successfully.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2022-01-04-14-33-52-937.png!
h3. Workaround

Change the renderer from default text to wiki style [or] remove and re-enter the default value of the custom field.
fields.summary: Issue create fails with "Invalid Input" error

fields.description:
As of now, Column configuration will only suggest 25 matching patterns for the custom fields in the issue navigator page. It is not possible to add the column if the site has more numbers of custom fields.

The column configuration should be capable of searching in pagination.

h3. How to replicate?
* Add more than 25-30 custom fields with a similar name. e.g all should have the substring "Start Date"
* Search in the Column Configuration won’t show all the fields
 !Screenshot 2022-01-04 at 2.17.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
As of now, we can either rename the custom field so that search should pick that specific field.
Or, use this [endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-navigator-settings/#api-rest-api-3-settings-columns-get] call to add the column directly in the System tab.
fields.summary: Ability to search all the custom fields with similar names in issue navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating an issue fails with required custom fields due to {{Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: t.current.querySelectorAll is not a function}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a custom field using an app
 # define the custom field to be required

h3. Expected Results
No errors are present in the console.

h3. Actual Results
An error is show in the browser console.

When using the [new Jira issue create experience|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/what-is-the-new-jira-issue-create-experience/], the following error can be found:
{code:java}
Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: t.current.querySelectorAll is not a function
    at async-engagement-messages.b7deafad750abd49ab99.8.js:50
    at r (async-engagement-messages.b7deafad750abd49ab99.8.js:4)
    at s (async-engagement-messages.b7deafad750abd49ab99.8.js:4)
{code}

With the previous Jira issue create experience, the following error can be found:
{code:java}
Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: t.current.querySelectorAll is not a function
    at async-engagement-messages.b7deafad750abd49ab99.8.js:50
    at r (async-engagement-messages.b7deafad750abd49ab99.8.js:4)
    at s (async-engagement-messages.b7deafad750abd49ab99.8.js:4)
{code}

h3. Notes
This can be hard to identify if the required field is on a separate tab since no error message is presented to the users.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating an issue fails with required custom fields due to t.current.querySelectorAll is not a function

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user is granted the Edit permission of a dashboard but is not in all of the groups/project roles added to the View permission, the user is not able to edit the dashboard. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 groups (GroupA and GroupB)
# Create 2 users (User1 and User2)
# Add User1 into both groups
# Add User2 into GroupB only
# Grant GroupA and GroupB as _Viewers_ in a dashboard
# Grant single user User1 and User2 as _Editors_ in the same dashboard
# Login as User1 and edit the dashboard 
# In another browser, login as User2 and edit the dashboard

h3. Expected Results
Both User1 and User2 are able to edit the dashboard

h3. Actual Results
Only User1 can edit the dashboard. The Edit, Share and Delete dashboard functionality is hidden from User2

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dashboard not editable if the user does not belong to all the groups/project roles in the Viewers field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom field User Property field is editable when it should not be.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field using the type User Property Field (it says its a read-only field in the description)
 # Set a default value using a preset user property
 # Create an issue

h3. Actual Results
The field can be edited
h3. Expected Results

The field should not be editable
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User Property Field is editable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you move a project to the trash, its relation with permission schemes is still kept as that's something necessary in case you want to restore the project eventually.

But if you try to delete the associated permission scheme it will point out that the project in question is still using the permission scheme, although without saying taht the project is in the trash:
 !Screen Shot 2022-01-03 at 13.52.04.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2022-01-03 at 13.51.54.png|thumbnail! 

Error message:
{code}
The scheme cannot be deleted when there are projects associated with it.
{code}

h3. Suggestion

Modify the current messages so they state whether the associated project(s) are in the trash or not, which would make it easier for users to know where to look at.
fields.summary: State that a project is in the trash when deleting a permission scheme related to it

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new issue view, both within an existing issue, as well as when using the new issue create screen, any date fields that appear on the screen without a value set, can show a grayed out sample value of 2/18/1993.  
Note that this value is never actually being saved to the issue, and the date picker is still defaulting to the current day.  

However this display can cause confusion among users as this date is clearly not what is expected by users. (By default we'd typically expect to see the current date)

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud sites using the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Creating an issue:
# Create a new issue using the Create button in the top navigation bar
# Make sure the create screen contains at least 1 field of type date or date/time
# Inspect that field (no need to click on it)


Editing an issue:
# With an issue created already, this can also be seen when you click to edit an empty date or date/time field

h3. Expected Results
When a field has no value set, we would expect to actually see that field be empty (no values at all) OR we would expect that the display would be in line with what the date picker is defaulting to (typically the current date)


h3. Actual Results
Date field itself is defaulting to display a grayed out example value of 2/18/1993
(Note: this value is never being saved to any issues, this is just a default date of the AtlasKit package.)
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
For the create screen there is no work-around.
For editing existing issues, you can avoid this problem by [temporarily clicking through to the old issue view.|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/temporarily-click-through-to-the-old-issue-view/]
fields.summary: Creating a new issue or editing existing issue can show a default sample value of 2/18/1993 for any date or date/time field

fields.description:
As an user with Admin rights for Jira i would like to add apps from market place for specific groups to be created under Settings->User Management->Groups
Presently the apps are being granted access to all Jira users .

!image-2022-01-03-18-50-21-558.png!
fields.summary: Restrict access for JIRA marketplace apps to specific JIRA user groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 Depending on the scenario, when the user in on the Dashboard page, the browser scroll bar keeps "blinking", causing the page a "shaking" behavior.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
With the below setup:
* Windows 11
* Chrome 96.0.4664.110 - 64 bit.

Go to Dashboard, create a dashboard with 3 gadgets (3 columns), probably, because the first gadget is not large enough, it causes this "blinking/flickering" behavior. 

Certain zoom level of the web browser may cause the scrollbar on the page to flicker

h3. Expected Results

Screen should be displayed normally.

h3. Actual Results

Screen scrollbar starts flickering, causing a bad UX.

The below exception is thrown in the browser console:
 !image-2021-12-30-15-08-14-024.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Toggling the browser to full screen, but when it's not at full screen, there's currently no know workaround.
fields.summary: Flickering Gadgets on Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Customer wants to export the user list with their timezones. Using the API provided to the customer /rest/api/3/users/search it was found that, that some of the users timezone is not getting displayed ( Probability of returning empty timezone).
This REST API /rest/api/3/user/search has a limitation of 1000 users - This can return default time zone. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Please have the limit raised for the Rest API or have a variable in place where the customer can return results min value (1000) to max value ( 2000) page wise to retrieve all users

h3. Why This Is Important
Customer has more than 1000 users and wants to export the users with their timezone in a consistent way.
h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Export more than 1000 users with their timezone.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copying a Incoming Webhook triggered rule, Jira keeps using as reference the same webhook URL even though the trigger in the copy is changed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Rule 1 using Incoming Webhook trigger
 # Create a Rule 2 by copying Rule 1 (using .... > copy)
 # Change the trigger of Rule 2 to Manual trigger
 # Try to edit Rule 1 by adding any new component to it. Jira won't let you save it and will show you the following error:

{code:java}
The incoming webhook URL is already in use by another trigger. Please regenerate! {code}

Please see a quick video in which the behavior is reproduced: https://share.getcloudapp.com/P8u6gQoX

h3. Expected Results

Since Rule 2 trigger was updated, the webhook reference should not be considered anymore.
h3. Actual Results

Jira considers that the same webhook is being used by 2 rules at the same time and this makes webhook not to trigger Rule 1 anymore.

h3. Workaround

Change Rule 2 trigger to Incoming Webhook, what will make Jira to regenerate a new webhook URL. After that, it'll be possible to update the trigger to Manual trigger again.
fields.summary: When copying a Incoming Webhook triggered rule, Jira keeps using as reference the same webhook URL even though the trigger in the copy was updated

fields.description:
Problem definition:
Jira does not support integration with Amazon-AWS SNS-Simple Notification Service.

Suggested Solution:
Create integration between Jira cloud and Amazon-AWS SNS-Simple Notification Service.

Why is this important:
This will provide a service to our customers without the need of using Automation and Web Requests / Webhooks.
fields.summary: Jira integration between Amazon AWS Simple Notification Service SNS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Default values from. Message custom field are shown not formatted while bulk editing issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create messages custom fields and associate it to used screens. Use html attributes.
 # Bulk edit issues.

h3. Expected Results

The default value for message custom fields are shown formatted as HTML as described on the field type description:
!image-2021-12-30-15-36-27-301.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

It is shown unformatted.
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: When bulk editing issues, message custom field default values are shown unformatted

fields.description:
Actually, it is possible to add attachments on the transition screen by adding the attachment field to it.

But it doesn't show existing attachments on the issue.

It would be great if it would be possible to view the existing attachments in the transition screen.
fields.summary: Allow the ability to view existing attachments in the transition screen.

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

In the drop-down list of the permission scheme when granting permission to a specific "Group" OR when granting Global permissions OR project roles, if there are too many group entries with the same group name, the drop-down only lists the first 20 group matches. 

For example, if you tried to search group "user" and you have multiple groups named a-user, b-user, c-user, and so on. The list will be limited to the alphabetical descending results in the drop-down. The list is also limited to only showing 20 out of the total groups, therefore, if the specific group you're after is not in the first 20, you wouldn't be able to select it.

 
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create multiple groups with similar names, (user, a-user, b-user, c-user, etc..)
 # Make sure the total number of groups following the above criteria is above 20.
 # Go to a permission scheme > Click on Edit on any permission > Choose "Group" > On the column, type "user". 
 # The list will only consist of the first 20 results alphabetical from a-user all the way to the last result, which will not consist of "user".

Screenshot:
!error-part-1.png|width=782,height=442!
!error-part-2.png|width=781,height=429!

 
h3. *Expected Results*
When a user enters the group name, the drop-down list does provide the required group when searching. 

h3. *Actual Results*

The drop-down list does not provide the exact group name.

 
h3. *Workarounds*
Type the group name with caps lock for the first letter, for example for the group "users", search with "Users", the results comes out.
fields.summary: Group name is not listed in drop-down list if there are too many similar entries

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior

The [GET Permissions API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-permissions/#api-rest-api-3-permissions-get] can only be used to review permissions.

h3. Requested behavior
As a Jira Admin, I would like to set Global Permissions via the REST API.
fields.summary: Jira API for setting Global Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to search for rules in Global panel, the typing action has a delay.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the Automation rules global panel through Jira settings > System > Global automation
 # Try to look for any rule

h3. Expected Results

The search should not have any delay.
h3. Actual Results

Some letters are missed, and you need to wait Jira to look for each letter after you type the next one: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/Blud0kNd]
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Delay in typing when searching for Automation rules in global panel

fields.description:
Add a new Workflow Validator that checks if a field has a specific value as we have for the Condition "Value Field".

The Conditions just hide the transitions from the screen, and we would like a message to be shown (like Validators do) when trying to transition and the field does not match a specific value.
fields.summary: New Workflow Validator to check if field has specific value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Updating a custom field's description under Settings > Issues > Custom fields won't update the field's description in the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Settings > Issues > Custom fields
# Choose a custom field with no custom description in any *Configuration Scheme*, then update its description
# Open an issue that has this field on the screen



h3. Expected Results
The new description should be displayed when you hover your mouse over the (i) icon.

h3. Actual Results
The description is cached in the *Field Configuration*, even if blank.


h3. Workaround

You must go to the project's *Field Configuration* and update it - either leaving it blank then clicking on *Update* to inherit from the Global custom field settings, or overwriting with the same value as the global one.
fields.summary: Updating custom field's description in the global CF setting has no effect in the new issue view hover description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The letters do not get registered properly when using filter rules in Jira Automation. There is a delay on the input or ignored entirely.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Goto Jira Automation
 # Search the rule by adding the text in Filter Rule

!image-2021-12-28-16-37-34-166.png|width=631,height=130!
h3. Expected Results

The entry of text in the search box should be without any delay.
h3. Actual Results

The letters do not get registered properly, due to which the search results are not correct.
h3. Workaround

To allow a delay between the letters when typing the text.
fields.summary: The search for Filter rules in automation does not register well.

fields.description:
When we perform a "quick search" on the numeric text like 123 or any random number, Jira tries to search for it as an issue key in the recently accessed project. This is expected behavior as mentioned in our Public Document - [JIRA Quick Search and the issue key prefix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-quick-search-and-the-issue-key-prefix-646250925.html]

On the other hand, if we make a "quick search" for a string type value then it searches for that text across the projects and gives us the relative list of issues. 

Requesting for a feature to allow making "quick searches" on numeric digits in the same manner as the strings.
fields.summary: unable to make "Quick Search" on numeric digits across projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there is an existing short/rich text custom field on an issue, and that field contains a value, then you delete the value, a JQL search for the value will still return a result.

The expectation is that after removing the value, that the JQL will not return the result.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a short/rich text custom field
 # create issue and set the field value to any non-empty string “Test123”
 # Delete the value “Test123” from the field
 # Search for issues with the value "Test123" - issues will be returned despite the field being empty

h3. Expected Results

JQL search should not return the issues since the field is empty
h3. Actual Results

Issues are returned despite the custom field being empty
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting the value from a text custom field will return issue when searching that field's original value in JQL (value is not entirely deleted on back end)

fields.description:
It was noted that The created statuses will only be visible if they are in an active workflow, that is, related to a project otherwise it will not be returned.

 

A request has already been opened to change the documentation ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflow-statuses/#api-group-workflow-statuses)] with this detail, but we are also passing on the customer's suggestion where they suggest that this be changed so that the api starts to return all statuses regardless of whether it is active or not for the following reasons sent to us by the customer:

 
 # The API should return the same results as the UI does. Currently, the UI shows all statuses, while the API does not.

 # When I use the “Get Workflows” API, I do get inactive workflows. Looking at those workflows, {*}I see the ID of the missing statuses but I can’t retrieve more information about them{*}. It means that I see an ID of the status, but the use “Get Status” on that ID and get an error. That is very inconsistent behavior of the API.

 # Our software in Salto, which uses the Jira Cloud API, needs to process all workflows and all statuses. Currently you do not give us a way to do that, and it hurts our users' experience.

 

They also suggest that if it is not set this way by default that they at least then add a parameter to control the api's return as suggested below by the customer:

"... It can be by default or with some query parameter (“active=true/false”)."
fields.summary: "Get all statuses" REST API call does not return all statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When running the api call {color:#e8912d}/rest/api/2/user/picker?query=<username>{color} continuously, the api call at times will  give a response with 200 OK but zero results. In the back-end, we see it is actually hitting 429 (rate limiting). Need to propagate 429 as a response for the api call too.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 : Run {color:#e8912d}/rest/api/2/user/picker?query=<username> {color}multiple times.
 # Most of the times it gives a result.
 # At times it will give an empty list with 200 OK response – On checking the back-end we see it actually hitting the rate limiting with a 429 error code.

h3. Expected Results

It should give a 429, as seen in the backend. This way the customers can understand that they are actually hitting the rate limit.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
{"users":[],"total":0,"header":"Showing 0 of 0 matching users"}{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround

No workaround. 

This is more of a missing information that the customer's are not receiving and creating confusion.
fields.summary: Rate limiting response of 429 not being propagated.

fields.description:
h4. Issue
 * Unable to search 'status' column in issue navigator when I have many custom fields include 'status' in the filed name.

h4. Suggestion
 * Users should be able to search the 'status' column successfully even when there are many custom fields contain 'status' in their name.

h4. Workaround

Option I
 # Perform an issue query or click "View all issues and filters" to cause a list of issues to be displayed.
 # Click on the "Columns" dropdown.
 # Scroll to the bottom of the list.
 # Right-click anywhere in the Columns chooser, but this puts you close to the tag you're going to be looking for in step 6.
 # Select "Inspect" (on Chrome). This should open a browser development window to the right where you can inspect and modify the page's HTML.
 # In the "Elements" window at the top of the inspection area (on Chrome), scroll down until you see an element titled "<select id="user-column-sparkler"...>".
 # Expand "user-column-sparkler".
 # Expand "optgroup label" within it.
 # Scroll down until you find the node "<option title="Status" value="status">Status</option>" (It may be necessary to click "Show all nodes" to see it.)
 # Right-click on that node and select "Add attribute". Type: selected="selected". The node should now read:
"<option title="Status" value="status" selected="selected">Status</option>"
 # Click "Done" back in the column chooser widget.
 # The "Status" column should now appear in your issues list. It should not be necessary to repeat this.

Option II
 # Rename the custom field to something else which does not cause this issue in the Column search.
 # Add this renamed field as a column to the List View in the Issue Navigator
 # Rename the custom field back to what it originally was
fields.summary: Unable to search 'status' column in issue navigator when I have many custom fields include name 'status'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copying an image from Windows Explorer to a comment in a Jira issue is creating the attachment appending the timestamp

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Copy an image file from Windows Explorer and paste it in a comment

h3. Expected Results
Should show the original name.

h3. Actual Results
Changes the file name appending the timestamp to it. 

*It only happens with image files*

h3. Workaround
Drag and drop the file or attach using the files & image button to browse to and select the file.
fields.summary: Copying an image from Windows Explorer to a comment in a Jira issue is creating the attachment appending the timestamp

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL search where having a wildcard at the beginning of a word (prefix) is giving an error whereas the suffix search is working as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Issue Navigator
 # JQL search : 
{code}
description ~ "*test"
{code}

 !Screenshot 2021-11-25 at 5.50.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
We should not set the error as attached

h3. Actual Results
Getting an error message

This behaviour is in accordance with our public document where its mentioned that we can use * or ? at the *end of a word. 
 ** https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/search-syntax-for-text-fields/ (Term searches).

This is because we use [lucene|https://lucene.apache.org/core/] as for our search engine. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Suffix Search in Jira Cloud does not work

fields.description: It would be great to have a gadget in the dashboard that shows the *Jira issues in the Y-axis* and *custom field type in Y-axis* and the summed-up data at the bottom.  !image-2021-12-24-02-07-26-091.png|width=457,height=117!
fields.summary: Gadget to show number of custom fields

fields.description:
+*Issue Summary*+

Users aren't able to create an Epic Link without Edit permissions in Cloud and Server instances of Jira. However, Parent Link from an Epic to an Initiative does not require Edit permissions. This seems inconsistent, and users are granted more permissions than they really need in a lot of cases when Edit permissions are provisioned _just_ for Epic Linking capability.

*Test Process on Cloud:*
 # Two projects (Plan A and Plan B) were created. They both use the same permissions scheme which grants two project roles named "CDS User" and "CDS Project Admin Role" access to the projects. Edit permissions are revoked for the "CDS User" project role.
 # An Epic was created in project Plan A logged in as a user with the "CDS User" project role access. A Story was created in Project Plan B, and an Epic was selected from project Plan A to link it, had the option to link, etc. However, the issue doesn't appear to be linked.
 # The permissions scheme was updated to grant Link Issues permission to the CDS User role and was met with the same result when tested again.
 # Logged in as a user with the CDS Project Admin Role, the same story from project Plan B was linked to the epic in Plan A without an issue. It appears as though one requires Edit permissions to link a story from one project to an epic within another.
 # It appears one doesn't require Link permissions to create a link for issues between projects. Link permissions were revoked for both project roles in the scheme, and I was still able to create an issue link with the CDS Project Admin role (the one that has Edit permissions).

*Test process on Server:*
 # Two projects in Server were created:
 # Plan A (PA)
 # Plan B (PB)


 # Two project roles were created:
 # Users (Plan A/B)
 # Proj. Admin (Plan A/B)


 # A new permission scheme was created that is used by both projects. I granted Edit and Link rights to the Proj. Admin (Plan A/B) role and the Users (Plan A/B) role wasn’t granted either permission.
 # Logged in as a user assigned the Users (Plan A/B) role, an epic in project Plan A was created, a story creation in project Plan B was attempted, an attempt was made to link the story to the Epic, and this error message was the result. In Cloud, the issue creation occurred sans error message.
 # Link permissions were added to the Users (Plan A/B) role, attempted to create a story, link it to the epic, and was met with the same error message above.
 # After granting Edit permissions to the Users (Plan A/B) role, a link to the story from Plan B to the epic in Plan A without an issue.
 # Link permissions were removed from the Users (Plan A/B) role, and then was still able to link a story to an Epic.
fields.summary: Users aren't able to create an Epic Link without Edit permissions in Cloud and Server instances of Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If if the mandatory field has value in it, transition fails with error stating the field is empty. 

The same transition will work on Mac, windows or android.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Put value in mandatory field 
 # Try to transition tickets from one state to another.

h3. Expected Results

The transition should be successful 
h3. Actual Results

The transition will fail stating the Mandatory Field is empty.
h3. Workaround

User any OS but iOS to do it successfully.
fields.summary: iOS || Missing value error for mandatory field during transition

fields.description:
Currently, we have the condition to block parent issue transition depending on sub-task status.

*Suggestion:* It would be nice to have a condition to block Epic issue transition depending on Story status.

*Possible solution:* Admins can use third-party add-ons like [ScriptRunner for Jira Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6820/scriptrunner-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] to configure [Workflow Conditions|https://scriptrunner-docs.connect.adaptavist.com/jiracloud/conditions.html] or [Workflow Validators|https://scriptrunner-docs.connect.adaptavist.com/jiracloud/validators.html].
fields.summary: Add a new workflow condition to transition: Parent-Task Blocking Condition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From the Global permission page, we are unable to {*}view users{*}. The redirection is not happening properly to the groups.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the Global permission page with the new user management experience especially with the new sites
 # Please access [https://xxx.atlassian.net/secure/admin/GlobalPermissions!default.jspa]
 #  Click on *view users* under Users / Groups it does not redirect to the group page and keeps loading the page for long.

h3. Expected Results

Redirect to the group page
h3. Actual Results

Attaching the screenshot of the page. From the dev tool, we see an error No group found. However, if we manually go to the group's page it shows the users under the group.
h3. Workaround

_view groups under the directory -->  https://admin.atlassian.com/o/\{orgId}/groups
fields.summary: From the Global permission page, we are unable to view users. The redirection is not happening properly to the groups.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

For any changes that we configure in the Slack integration, user gets notified. These notifications include changes made by *Automation for Jira* user as well.

This cannot be customised currently even under personal settings in Slack

!Screenshot 2021-12-23 at 11.50.51 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option either in the integration or personal settings configuration to disable emails for actions performed by Automation user.
fields.summary: Allow admins to customise what slack notifications should be received by users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the new create issue experience doesn't filter correctly the visible options for custom fields. 
This leads to unexpected options being available in the custom fields created by apps.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a custom field using an app
 # define the custom field to be {{nonSelectable}} for a subset of projects
 # create a new issue with such custom field

h3. Expected Results
Only the available options are visible for a specific project.

h3. Actual Results
All options are visibles, including the ones that are not available for the project in use.

h3. Known impact on apps
This is impacting the [Tempo Timesheets - Time Tracking & Reports|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6572/tempo-timesheets-time-tracking-reports?tab=overview&hosting=cloud] app.
For this app, the "Account" field contains all the configured accounts, including the ones not configured for the selected project and the ones that are not OPEN.

h3. Workaround
Since this only occurs when using the new create issue experience (https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Announcement-New-Issue-Create-modal-will-be-available-to-all/ba-p/1874003), the workaround is to switch back to the legacy Issue Create modal by going to Personal Jira Settings -> Jira Labs -> New Global Issue Create Experience -> Switch to the old Experience.
fields.summary: Using the new create issue experience doesn't filter correctly the visible options for custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an issue has a mandatory field the value of this field is not correctly rendered in the iOS app causing transitions to  fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with a mandatory field in the web version of Jira
# Attempt a transition for the issue


h3. Expected Results
The issue should transition as expected

h3. Actual Results
An error displaying the names of the mandatory fields is thrown stating that they are required even if they have valid information.

h3. Workaround
Transitioning issues in the web version of Jira
fields.summary: Transitioning an issue with a mandatory field in the iOS app fails

fields.description:
At the moment, when moving issues of non-epic type to Epic type using bulk operation, the users are given an option to Enter the Epic name in step 3.
This can be quite a time consuming when moving multiple issues to the Epic.

Suggestion: Having an option to use the value in Summary or some other custom field for the Epic Name field will be quite helpful.
fields.summary: Epic name while moving issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Actions based on objects are not available on rules created on JSW projects. Users need to create Global rules.
h3. Suggested Solution

Enable actions based on objects on JSW
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Actions based on objects are not available on rules created on JSW projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Workflow Diagram Status text and background color has changed to Black color and now statuses in Done and In Progress category are really hard to read and you can't read the 'All' for Global transitions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Open any Workflow Scheme with Diagram view.
 !Screen Shot 2021-12-22 at 09.44.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
It's better to have white lettering on darker colors.

h3. Actual Results
You see black lettering and it's really hard to read status names now.

h3. NOTE:
This color pallet violates the Atlassian design guidelines with Dark Text on a dark background flagged as a "Fail" condition:
- https://atlassian.design/foundations/color
{quote}We use blue (B400) for primary actions, buttons, text links, for indicating progress and representing authentication. Neutral (N800) is used primarily for body text and headings, and white (N0) is used for page backgrounds.{quote}
 !Screen Shot 2021-12-22 at 11.26.43 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use the Text View for now.
fields.summary: Color on Workflow Diagram makes text hard to read

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Field configuration shows all the fields, system + custom. This makes the list few pages long and difficult to manage.

There should be a way to remove the unwanted fields from the list.

Another way is to be *able to filter list based upon the Hidden or Show property* of the field. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Please navigate to Jira settings > Field Configuration
 # Open any configuration created manually. 
 # We can see list spread across multiple pages

h3. Expected Results

List should only contain the fields that we want. 
h3. Actual Results

The list contains all the fields custom + system , marked hidden or Show
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at this moment.
fields.summary: Ability to remove fields completely from the field configuration list.

fields.description:
Currently, the payload sent on the *Send Web Request* action when selecting *Issue Data* is not processible by opsgenie.
Opsgenie is able to process the payload sent by Legacy Automation and Webhooks only.

Could add this as an option. Would potentially open up some more integrations that already work with JIRA's existing webhook body format.
fields.summary: Automation Outgoing webhook should be able to send JSON identical to JIRA's outgoing webhook

fields.description:
If an E-Mail is sent to our Jira SD address, every recipient in CC is automatically created as a Service Desk Customer.

Now, we have to manually administer those customer accounts and manually associate them with organizations.

For our projects, it would be very helpful to have an option allowing to assign the newly created accounts to the sender's organisation automatically. (In most cases, the sender's organisation is known)
fields.summary: Assign CC recipients to senders organisation automatically

fields.description: I have an issue view with a single looping transition in the workflow, so the action appears as a button. When the transition is triggered, the button temporarily disappears, but with no indication of action being performed or completed. A visual indicator that something is happening and maybe that it's completed would be useful.
fields.summary: Add progress indicator on looping transition button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we select multiple issues in the backlog for a scrum project, the total number of selected issues is not rendered properly in Google Chrome.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the *Backlog* of your project.
 # Select multiple issues.
!image-2021-12-21-19-18-11-328.png|width=281,height=87!
 # Try to move any one of the issues.

h3. Expected Results

The same works fine in Firefox
!Screenshot 2021-12-21 at 7.20.54 PM.png|width=281,height=87!
h3. Actual Results

The total number of selected issues is not rendered properly.
!Screenshot 2021-12-21 at 7.19.22 PM.png|width=281,height=87!
h3. Workaround

Currently, a workaround is to use a different browser other than Google Chrome
fields.summary: The number of issues selected does not render in Google Chrome

fields.description:
One of the customers would like to see the list of dashboards in the left navigation bar while open the dashboard is shown in the right panel. 

Currently, we cannot navigate the list of dashboards on the left side as it is by design
fields.summary: Left sidebar doesn't shown while accessing dashboard

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a cascading field for JWM.

And the cascading field integrated with the form feature.
fields.summary: Cascading field support in Jira Work Management

fields.description:
*Problem / Context*

When working towards a release there are often bugs that come up that are scheduled in the current or next sprints. 

What this normally means is that after raising an issue and assigning it to a release, the item is assigned by default to the bottom of the selected sprint backlog. 

This means having to navigate to the backlog or sprint view, selecting the team member, and then manually moving the item to other similar issues that they are working on (i.e. Epic and Release). 

It would be great to have a setting that allows this to happen automatically.

 

*User Story*

As a SCRUM Master / Product Manager

I want to have my issues ordered in the backlog automatically based on release or epic

So that I don't have to manually reorder the backlog every time a new issue is created
fields.summary: Auto prioritise similar items in backlog by Epic and Release

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Radio Button custom field
# Add it to a project's *Create issue* screen.
# Try to create an issue

h3. Expected Results

The field shows up as a Radio button shows up correctly.

h3. Actual Results

The radio button shows up as a Select List.
 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
- Contact the Atlassian Cloud support
fields.summary: Radio button custom fields show up as dropdown on the new Create Issue modal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copying an Excel cell into a text field during Issue creation will add an image of that cell into the Description field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy an Excel cell
 # Paste it into a text field

h3. Expected Results
The cell's content is added to the text field

h3. Actual Results
The cell's content is added to the text field *and a image of the cell is added into the Description field*.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copying an Excel cell into a text field during Issue creation will add an image of that cell into the Description field

fields.description: As a user, I would like to allow Site-admins to edit the Changelog of issues if needed, as this may cause issues with reports that currently cannot be fixed in the UI.
fields.summary: Allow Site-admins to update Jira Changelog dates

fields.description:
The options in the dropdown get cramped up for the last column in the table and there is no way to slide it or view the options properly

Expected:- Please create a slider for such scenarios where the tables are embedded inside the description.

 !Image 2021-12-20 at 9.03.43 PM.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The layout gets affected in the Description field when working with tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to move an issue and its Sub-task from one project to another, it's requested to enter a value for a field that is NOT required in the target/origin project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Issue for a Project A
# Remove Project A from a specific Custom Field Context
# Perform a move on the issue from Project A to the Project B

h3. Expected Results
The Move process should NOT require the custom field and the process should be completed.

h3. Actual Results
The Custom Field from which Project A was removed from its context starts being requested.

h3. Workaround
Add the Originating project to the Custom Field's Context and the move works without requiring the field.
fields.summary: When moving an issue to another project, if the originating project isn't part of the custom field's context, the CF is required

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We noticed that sometimes the performance of this endpoint [/rest/api/3/issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-post] to create issues can be improved to reduce friction with other system integrations.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Make a POST request to "/rest/api/3/issue" on a site that has many integrations or other requests being processed.

h3. Expected Results
The request should be processed within a few ms.

h3. Actual Results
The request might take up a few seconds to be processed depending upon the environment complexity.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Improve overall performance of the public create issue API endpoint

fields.description:
It would be useful to have a feature to create sub-tasks on a full _create issue_ screen available in Jira Cloud.

As of now, if you set any field displayed on your sub-task as required, Jira will pop up the full create issue screen.
fields.summary: Allow full create issue screen for sub-tasks

fields.description:
Currently, the Bubble chart dashboard gadget shows data using Days open and comment fields. 
The chart should allow selecting the value used for the x-axis to provide more flexibility.
fields.summary: Add other fields to bubble chart gadget

fields.description:
A desktop app for Jira that support multiple operating system. 

References. Request from other Atlassian resources:
 * [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Is-there-a-Jira-Windows-app/qaq-p/875086]
fields.summary: Jira desktop app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A User Interface improvement made last year (*JRACLOUD-27957*) created a confirmation dialog-box for when a user selects to delete a Custom Field context.

There appears to be a feature regression where this is no longer the case and users are able to delete the context without prompt. Furthermore, clicking the *X* to delete, there is no indication that the data has been removed until the user refreshes the page. Clicking the *X* again results in a *HTTP 500* error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Custom Field that has context
# Click on the *X* next to the context

h3. Expected Results
Based on *JRACLOUD-27957* a dialog-box should pop-up requiring the user to confirm they want to delete the context.

h3. Actual Results
There is no dialog-box nor any additional verification or warning to make sure the user has intended to delete the context.

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting a Custom Field context does not require confirmation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
By sending a project to the trash when the project lost the reference for the Permission Scheme, the project will be permanently deleted when you try to restore it from the trash. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send a project to the trash
# Try to Restore it

h3. Expected Results
The project should be restored. 

h3. Actual Results
The project is permanently deleted. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Restoring a project from trash without a permission scheme associated to it makes Jira delete it permanetly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Based on [Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] documentations, admin need to whitelist a big number of IP. Some company will have a concern about allowing a big amount of IP going into their firewall.
h3. Suggested Solution

It will be great if Atlassian Cloud have the ability to narrow down the IP based on product.
fields.summary: Reduce the IP address range to be whitelisted based on product

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users who have site access but not product access to Jira are unable to self join Jira if Jira Service Management is present. Instead, they are redirected to the Jira Service Management portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a site with Jira and JSM, and a user who has site access but not Jira access.
# Visit Jira as this user.
# Confirm that you can only visit the JSM help area and are unable to join Jira.

h3. Expected Results
The user has some way of joining Jira as a licensed user.

h3. Actual Results
The user is not able to become a licensed user via self sign up.

h3. Workaround
* Manually add this user to a group that grants Jira product access. More information here on [updating product access|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/update-product-access-settings/].
* If the user has access to Confluence, they can navigate to Confluence and then use the App Switcher in the top left of the page to choose Jira, which allows the user to self join Jira.
fields.summary: Unable to self sign up for Jira when Jira Service Management is present and user is apart of the site userbase

fields.description:
I configured a service project B to be open to "Everyone on the internet" (Project settings, Customer permissions). Everyone who knows the projects email-adress should be able to raise a support request.  

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170402i610D8F6B929E1032/image-size/large?v=v2&px=999!

The problem with this setting is, that all my customers from other projects suddenly appear in the customer list (Project, customers) of project B. For example, my test-user from project A. There seems to be no option to remove the user from customers. Also the user's not shown under project settings -> people, so it cannot be deleted there.

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170403i8EB81DBF1A5F5BCA/image-size/large?v=v2&px=999!

As a result, Project B is shown to all my users from Project A in the customer portal. Technically, everyone is allowed to raise requests in project B, but the project is not relevant to my customers from project A.

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/170404i38A9700D04525A2B/image-size/large?v=v2&px=999!

My suggestion would be to allow deletion of customers in this case.

Or, alternatively, not to add the customers from other projects automatically.
fields.summary: Customers from other projects are added automatically and cannot be removed from customer list

fields.description:
Hi All,

We have an internal requirement where we need custom fields only to be changeable by users from a certain group.

Please take this into consideration.

Kind regards,

Reinout
fields.summary: Permissions on custom fields

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In the new issue view, users are unable to vote on issue which are moved to a Done status category even though the resolution of the issue is not set.

In the Jira old issue view, users are able to vote on issues in Done status category if the resolution is not set on the issue.

h4. Suggestion
It would be great if admin can be provided with the options to control the voting abilities in the new issue view such as:
* Allow voting based on:
a) Done status category
b) Resolution field (Similar to the old view)
fields.summary: Ability to vote on issues based on the resolution field instead of the Done status category

fields.description:
When checking the CI/CD page for Jira - https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/guides/developers/ci-cd#connect-your-cicd-tools
We can see that there are some vendors listed but AWS pipelines is not in there.
I'd like to require if it could be possible to develop and add this integration to the list.
fields.summary: Add AWS Pipeline support as a CI/CD tool in Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an project is archived during routine Jira Project housekeeping it isn't removed from Automation for Jira rules.  No warning is presented during the project archive warning of impact to multi-project automation rules.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a multi-project automation rule in Automation for Jira
 # Archive one of the included projects
 # View the automation rule's log - there will be a failure message similar to:

!image-2021-12-16-10-56-04-618.png!
h3. Expected Results

A warning should be presented when archiving or deleting projects that are included in multi-project automations.

 

*Suggested resolution to this bug:*

If a project is archived which is included in any multi-project automations

1 - present a warning to the user to indicate which automations are impacted

2 - prompt for 'remove project from automations'?

If yes - fix the impacted automations to remove the project

If no - opt to cancel the archive or to continue anyway.
h3. Actual Results

Project is archived or deleted.

_Failure is listing in the impacted automation rule log(s).  "JQL search failed for some issues. .... value with ID '#####' does not exist for the field 'project'._
h3. Workaround

After archiving or deleting projects check ever automation rule for failures, then edit impacted rules to remove the archived or deleted projects.
fields.summary: Archiving or Deleting a Jira Project results with failure in multi-project Automation Rules

fields.description:
The table of the Burndown Chart Report currently shows which person started and stopped a sprint. This is done by the text "Sprint started by ..." and "Sprint ended by ...".

As a Burndown Chart user it is important and useful for us to see which person has reported which time on which issue.

This is currently not displayed.

We ask to include this information in the table and to realize it, based on the information who started and stopped the sprint, e.g. with the text "Worked logged by ...".
fields.summary: Show person who has logged the time in the Burndown Chart report

fields.description:
Allow the custom fields to have the same order as the configuration in the search front end instead of just the alphabetical order by default. 

*Reproduction Steps:*
If you have a custom field with multiple options in the dropdown the search front end using filters or the issue search will sort the options in alphabetical order and doesn't respect the order of the custom field configuration.

*What Happens*
Issues are not sorted based on the sequence order in which Custom Field options were defined. Instead, they are sorted alphabetically.
fields.summary: Allow the custom fields to have the same order as the configuration in the search front end

fields.description:
I want to be able to expand all instead of each epic individually.

 

!image-2021-12-15-14-27-37-514.png!
fields.summary: Add an "Expand all" function to the board roadmap feature

fields.description:
When 2 or more looping transitions (from a status to itself) are available in a workflow status, they appear in the issue view under the "Actions" dropdown.

!Screen Shot 2021-12-15 at 13.42.26.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggestion

Implement the ability to rename the "Actions" button so it's more customizable.
fields.summary: Ability to rename workflow "Actions" button on issue view
Search for issues using JQL (POST) (/rest/api/3/search) with `fields=[issuetype]` should return `untranslatedName` in response

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we add just a single user in the "Notification Scheme", for any event, let say, "Issue Deleted", the Notification Helper on the failed conditions, complains that the user is not the reporter or current assignee.

If the Reporter or Assignee are not associated with the "Issue Deleted" event then why ven Notification Helper is testing that?

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*1*. Create a Notification Scheme as attached below:
 !Screenshot 2021-12-07 at 6.12.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

*2*. See the Notification Helper result on a failed condition:
 !Screenshot 2021-12-07 at 6.13.02 PM.png|thumbnail! 

*3*. Notification Helper on a passed scenerio:
 !Screenshot 2021-12-15 at 3.05.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Expected Results
The Notification Scheme should mention something like that the current user is not eligible to receive notification for the "Issue Deleted" event.

h3. Actual Results
In both the failed and passed scenario, the notification Scheme checks if the user is Assignee or a Reporter which confuses a user. Let's make the "Notification Helper" output more user-friendly and clear.


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect "Notification Helper" check when a single user is associated with any event.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you create a 4 columns table, in editor issue view, the “downward arrow” that creates more columns creates a dropdown, which is then cut off
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table on the Issue Description
 # Click downward Arrow for rightmost cell to get dropdown

h3. Expected Results
The Drop Down menu should not get hidden.

h3. Actual Results
The Dropdown menu should not get hidden under the right side Issue column.
 !image-2021-12-15-12-15-10-941.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The “downward arrow” that creates more columns in Table creates a dropdown which is hidden In Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Background

Currently you can configure anonymous access (as per [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/allow-anonymous-access-to-projects/]) to allow *Anyone* to be able to view and/or create issues in a project. This allows unlicensed users to do these actions even without logging in.

You can also set these permissions to *Any logged-in user* so that the general internet can't view/create issues. However, for these logged in users product access/a Jira license is still needed for them to have access to the project.
h3. Desired Results

We have encountered a use case where an admin would like to be able to provide "anonymous" access to anyone only within their particular organization. That is, only users within their organization would be able to create/view/watch issues without specifically having to have a Jira license/product access, while users from the general internet and Atlassian accounts not part of their own organization would be denied access.
fields.summary: allow anonymous access to be more configurable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user requests access to Jira, the request is sent to the Jira administrator without any prior approval

h3. Suggestion
Add a manager approval flow in order to have the access approved before reaching Jira Admin.

For instance, It could be an interaction with the directory service in order to get the manager's email address automatically.
fields.summary: Add a manager approval flow to the product access request.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pie Chart gadget ("Statistic Type: Issue Type") doesn't group up the same type on Team-Managed projects. 
 # Create a filter that includes at least:
 ## 1 (or more) Team-managed project and 1 (or more) Company-Managed Project
 OR
 ## 2 (or more) Team Managed Projects
 # Create a Dashboard add Pie Chart
 # Configure it:
 ## Use the created filter.
 ## "Statistic Type: Issue Type"

h3. Expected Results

It should group the same issue types by name.
h3. Actual Results

1 row for each TM project

h3. Workaround
Use Issue Statistics Gadget and Sort by Natural instead.
fields.summary: Pie Chart gadget doesn't group up same type on Team-Managed projects for "Statistic Type: Issue Type"
